column1: I couldn’t agree more @EllenforAustin the engagement of conservative women in policy and politics on the local state and federal level is paramount. I'm so proud to serve alongside amazing conservative women in the House of Representatives.   https://t.co/Bx4ax3N9OG

234 years ago Thomas Jefferson's Virginia Statute for Religious Freedom was officially adopted. Our freedom to worship serves as the cornerstone of our democracy. We are so blessed to live in a country that protects our right to practice our faith #ReligiousFreedomDay https://t.co/5QAzDg1XMm

Recently I had the pleasure of sitting down with @FrontRowmarc to discuss my work in Washington the needs of our veterans the economy and many other issues. To view the full interview click the link below 👇   https://t.co/PARrDpK7Fj

Happy National Law Enforcement Appreciation Day! Today we recognize and thank the brave men and women who work tirelessly to keep our families and communities safe. We are so grateful for your service. #BackTheBlue https://t.co/zC1bvhcKTX

Now that the GREAT Act has been signed into law our federal grant reporting system will finally be brought into the 21st century. I’m so proud to have worked alongside @RepJimmyGomez to make government more accountable and transparent for the American people.

Rep @RepJimmyGomez and I are working to bring federal grant reporting into the 21st century adding efficiency for grant recipients and transparency for taxpayers with searchable documents and open data. Today our GREAT Act is headed to the desk of @POTUS. https://t.co/J83F7DGnED
This sham #impeachment inquiry now has a sham impeachment resolution to go with it. My full statement on this disgraceful process ⤵️ https://t.co/peVfDElIwa

@HouseGOP 2. Rep. Bonamici called @RepDustyJohnson's amdt requiring university health care facilities to ensure medical care is provided to infants BORN ALIVE “an attempt to insert policymakers in medical decisions that belong to women & their health care providers.”

Not once but TWICE today in HEA mark-up Dems stumble w/ rhetoric to mischaracterize @HouseGOP’s views on human life. They had no response to my remarks. 📺 Watch ⬇️ 1. Rep. Tekano: “We need to take a step back from efforts to dehumanize the immigrants that are in our country.” https://t.co/bI7QHGh5tX
@POTUS has shown there is no safe place for terrorists under his command and I thank him and all our troops for keeping our country free and safe. https://t.co/V3L9SmXMVp

Thanks to the relentless efforts of our military's special operations al-Baghdadi is dead and our world is a safer place today. This victory is the result of our troops' selfless sacrifices and superior work w/ our nation's intelligence operatives to bring terrorists to justice.

Instead of apologize to the American people for lying about the Mueller investigation @RepAdamSchiff just doubles down on his partisan impeachment agenda with more lies. Tonight I voted for a motion to censure and condemn him in the House. Americans deserve to know the truth. https://t.co/QbvqQhbrlh

@RepCummings was a respected colleague and will be greatly missed in the House of Representatives. I’m keeping him his family and loved ones in my prayers as they mourn the loss of a man who loved serving his country.
Wishing a grace-filled Day of Atonement to all observing Yom Kippur. https://t.co/gcT3on9v1J

Wonderful spending time w/ Principal Llewellyn at CB Eller Elementary. He's a fabulous principal respected by the terrific teachers and staff and knows the name of every student. Principals like him deserve thanks every day but let’s make a special effort w/ #ThankAPrincipal. https://t.co/0D1Bm8MTWq
@NicholasEvtimo3 Time with students is always time well spent. Glad you remember and still appreciate my talk Nicholas!
Shana tova to everyone celebrating #RoshHashanah! May you be blessed with a healthy and happy year.

Hunger Action Month is about combating food insecurity for the many who don't know when their next meal will be. Thanks @Foodlion for raising awareness with the #NoEmptyPlate challenge and aiming to provide one billion meals by 2025 through #NoEmptyPlate and #FoodLionFeeds. https://t.co/BSv4uSbf0Q

2 hrs ago the DNI delivered the whistleblower's complaint to the House. 2 mins ago I voted for a res. in support of this action because we need FACTS to get to the bottom of allegations not partisan speculation feeding outrage culture with calls for impeachment w/o evidence.

#Didyouknow chemical abortions have higher rates of complications and ER visits than surgical ones? Transparency about health risks is pro-woman policy and the #SAVEMomsandBabies Act would ensure the dangers of DIY abortions aren't hidden. I'm proud to cosponsor this bill. https://t.co/MasIZNrbqG
Great to have @NCTrucking in the DC office today to discuss the issues that impact jobs and families supported by the trucking industry! https://t.co/wYb3dTNJcE
Happy birthday to the @usairforce! Thanks to all airmen who serve and have served defending our skies over the last 72 years! #USAF https://t.co/53foZCKj2X

While @SenatorSchumer and solution-minded Democrats align themselves with Republicans I call on @SpeakerPelosi to continue our progress addressing the border crisis by bringing up bipartisan legislation to reform our immigration policy.

Let it not be said that caring for children and families at our Southern border needs to be a partisan issue. @HouseGOP just delivered $4.6 billion to abet the humanitarian crisis AND strengthen border security. The Senate arrived at this solution yesterday in a 84 – 8 vote.

While @HouseDemocrats' budget itself ultimately didn’t come for a vote I'm encouraged by the House's willingness to address out-of-control spending in Washington and look forward to future opportunities to advance my Spending Safeguard Act as we debate a budget. (3/4)

This week in a fleeting moment of bipartisanship the House voted to consider my legislation to take spending off autopilot. Amid the partisan caps bill put forth and then pulled by @HouseDemocrats I was pleased my Spending Safeguard Amendment was accepted for debate. (2/4)

Unchecked spending is the main driver of our national debt and by 2028 it will constitute a whopping 15% of our GDP. This is simply unsustainable. Yet there are no commonsense safeguards to rein in spending beyond our budget. (1/4)

that considers only 1 of 2 people involved in an abortion. I’ll continue to fight for the rights of the unborn and I pray for our culture to realize their rights are not a threat to women’s rights. All life is valuable and deserves to be protected by law not legally devalued.
